intro: Nototriche candaravica, commonly known as the Canary Island mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Nototriche candaravica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
